user_id.description: User ID.  Provide a value of `0` to operate the current session's user.

cursor.description: Used for pagination.  When a list request has more records available, cursors are provided in the response headers `X-Files-Cursor-Next` and `X-Files-Cursor-Prev`.  Send one of those cursor value here to resume an existing list from the next available record.  Note: many of our SDKs have iterator methods that will automatically handle cursor-based pagination.

per_page.description: Number of records to show per page.  (Max: 10,000, 1,000 or less is recommended).

action_notification_export_id.description: ID of the associated action notification export.

$ul: **folder**: The folder associated with the triggering action for this notification.
**message**: A message indicating the overall status of the webhook notification.
**path**: The path to the actual file that triggered this notification.
**request_headers**: A JSON-encoded string with headers that were sent with the webhook.
**request_method**: The HTTP verb used to perform the webhook.
**status**: HTTP status code returned in the webhook response.
**success**: `true` if the webhook succeeded by receiving a 200 or 204 response.
